Articles.Content:
Just like my sr-71 it's mainly built with procedural dynamics. Flies really smooth and yes, i know the real b-2 didn't have a rudder, but this one needs it cause ksp.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

How did you make it that color?

Also, it looks awesome!!

Nice black parts. (?)

May I suggest hiding a rudder inside the fuselage? Since you don't really need yaw authority, all the rudder needs to do is keep the plane moving forwards, so hiding it in the fuselage, just behind the CoM seems like a good edit. Otherwise, looks very good.

Nice black parts. (?)

May I suggest hiding a rudder inside the fuselage? Since you don't really need yaw authority, all the rudder needs to do is keep the plane moving forwards, so hiding it in the fuselage, just behind the CoM seems like a good edit. Otherwise, looks very good.

Tried that already, it keeps sending it into a spin after the wheels no longer touch the runway, will have to keep it like this until i find a replacement/fix for it.

But how did you make it black?

And yeah, great job on the design.

But how did you make it black?

And yeah, great job on the design.

What this guy said ;p

Some new pictures of small updates, removed the tail fin and placed it inside the fuselage like someone advised me to.

Added ''bombs'' (i know they're just pylons shh) to the underside of the craft.

Testing the ''bombs'' (Again, shh ;p)

2 more pics showing some detail.

Schweet! Well Done.

Hehe, thanks . Although i really want to mke bomb bay doors but it's not possible due to the fuel tanks being in the way.. perhaps ill think of something
Any Idea on completion date? cause i wanna really fly this :-)
oh, completion date... i never noticed someone replied again, i can release the craft file if you want.
Yes please i jsut checked back lol hi :-) but def i would love the file
what mods do i need or any other stuff im missing?
